sentences.sContent: Make a list of all the things you have to do.
sentences.sCn: 把你必须做的所有事情列一个清单。

sentences.sContent: The first person on my list is Mrs Gilling.
sentences.sCn: 我的名单上排在第一位的是吉林夫人。

sentences.sContent: The guidebook lists 1,000 hotels and restaurants.
sentences.sCn: 旅游手册上列有1,000家宾馆和餐厅。

sentences.sContent: ...many graduate schools list this set of books as the reference books...
...Mysteries and detective stories came second on the list at 53%...
...to yoga-by time or to-do list to measure how they performed under "clock time" vs "task time"...
...task-timers have a list ofthings they want to accomplish...
...You are required to select one word for each blank _from a list o...
...Aches and pains are high on the list of complaints in old age...
...If you ask Japanese students to list the positive attributes they expect in a romantic partner...

phrases.pCn: adj. 在单子上，在名册中
列个清单；列出单子；造表
邮寄名单；发送文件清单
候补名单；等候批准的申请人名单

words.tran: 列出的；表列的；已登录的

trans.tranOther: a set of names, numbers etc, usually written one below the other, for example so that you can remember or check them
to write a list, or mention things one after the other
